metadata.title: CVE-2022-22822 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
addBinding in xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3 has aninteger overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22822` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.5-3ubuntu0.4
libexpat1 - 2.2.5-3ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

firefox - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

libxmltok1 - 1.2-4ubuntu0.18.04.1~esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.5-3ubuntu0.4').
xmlrpc-c package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
vnc4 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
wbxml2 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
coin3 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
matanza: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
tdom package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
libxmltok package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-4ubuntu0.18.04.1~esm4').
